title: Remove in-app wallet link and add social links + crypto address to registrant profiles

requirements.text: Remove the in-app wallet entry point from the application navigation (desktop header nav and mobile menu) so users no longer see any Wallet/OISY Wallet item, and ensure there is no remaining user-facing wallet-related UI text or tooltip in the app navigation.
acceptanceCriteria: The header navigation no longer renders the wallet navigation item on desktop.
The mobile menu no longer renders the wallet navigation item.
No wallet-related tooltip/disabled state messaging is shown anywhere in the navigation.

requirements.text: Remove unused OISY wallet configuration usage from the frontend so the app does not depend on or reference the OISY wallet URL environment variable (VITE_OISY_WALLET_URL) for any UI behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: The frontend builds without referencing OISY wallet URL configuration for navigation.
No runtime code paths attempt to open an OISY wallet URL.

requirements.text: Extend the backend registrant data model and APIs to support saving the following optional fields for each registrant: Facebook, Instagram, Telegram, website URL, and a crypto address, and persist these values in the registrant record returned by existing registrant read/list/search APIs.

quotes: permet aux utilisateurs d'enregistrer leurs réseaux sociaux : facebook, instagram, telegram, site internet,  adresse crypto.

acceptanceCriteria: Backend registrant type includes fields for Facebook, Instagram, Telegram, website, and crypto address (all optional).
Calling addRegistrant with these fields saves them and getRegistrant/listAllRegistrants/searchRegistrants return them.
Existing registrant functionality (create, read, list, search) continues to work for records that do not provide these optional fields.

requirements.text: Update the registration/profile form UI to allow authenticated users to input and save optional social links (Facebook, Instagram, Telegram, website) and an optional crypto address as part of their registrant profile, without making these fields required.

quotes: permet aux utilisateurs d'enregistrer leurs réseaux sociaux : facebook, instagram, telegram, site internet,  adresse crypto.

acceptanceCriteria: The registration page includes new optional inputs labeled in English: “Facebook”, “Instagram”, “Telegram”, “Website”, and “Crypto address”.
Submitting the form saves these values to the backend along with existing registrant fields.
When revisiting the registration page, previously saved values for these fields are pre-filled from the existing registrant record.
Leaving these fields empty does not block submission.

requirements.text: Update the directory UI to display a registrant’s social links (Facebook, Instagram, Telegram, website) and crypto address when present, and hide each field when it is not provided.

quotes: permet aux utilisateurs d'enregistrer leurs réseaux sociaux : facebook, instagram, telegram, site internet,  adresse crypto.

acceptanceCriteria: Directory cards conditionally render each social link field only if it exists for that registrant.
Directory cards conditionally render the crypto address only if it exists for that registrant.
The directory page remains usable and visually consistent when none of the optional fields are present for a registrant.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo (no additional backend services).
Do not edit any frontend files under frontend/src/components/ui or any paths listed in frontend.immutablePaths.
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: Do not add third-party social login or OAuth integrations (only store user-provided social link text).
Do not add any wallet feature replacement or alternative wallet integrations.
Do not change Internet Identity authentication behavior.

goalsToAdd: Remove the in-app wallet navigation entry point.
Allow users to save social links (Facebook, Instagram, Telegram, website) and a crypto address in their profile/registrant record.
preferencesToAdd: All new user-facing copy should be in English.
